node.title: Craig Kelly texted Australians again this week. Here's why you shouldn't believe the video he linked to
node.alt: Graphic of coronavirus blob with spikes with the header CoronaCheck
node.description: Australians received another round of text messages from United Australia Party MP Craig Kelly this week, linking to a video making dubious assertions about COVID-19 vaccines.
node.content:
["CoronaCheck is RMIT ABC Fact Check's weekly email newsletter dedicated to fighting the misinformation infodemic surrounding the coronavirus outbreak.", "You can read the latest edition below, and\u00a0subscribe\u00a0to have the next newsletter delivered straight to your inbox.", "
CoronaCheck #92
", "In this week's edition of CoronaCheck, we take a look at Craig Kelly's latest text mailout and its claims that vaccines have caused a surge in heart problems, with hospitals full of vaccinated patients.", "We also investigate whether NSW businesses are liable for compensating workers injured by the jab, and whether Italy has drastically reduced its COVID-19 death toll. Plus, what did Labor's election policy really say about electric vehicles?", "
Craig Kelly texts again
", "", "
Former Liberal MP Craig Kelly\u00a0defected to Clive Palmer's United Australia Party during the pandemic and has sent a number of unsolicited texts to Australians since.(ABC News: Ian Cutmore)
", "United Australia Party MP Craig Kelly has treated voters to a fresh round of unsolicited text messages, this time sharing a link to his website and a video full of false and misleading claims about COVID-19 vaccines.", "The claims, which suggested vaccines were behind a rise in hospitalisations, were made by a protester during a demonstration against mandatory jabs for healthcare workers, held in Adelaide on November 2.", "\"The hospitals are not full of COVID patients,\" claimed the protester, arguing they were instead \"full of vaccinated patients\".", "However, according to a statement provided to Fact Check by SA Health: \"There is no truth to the claims made by this individual.\"", "With\u00a0more than 90 per cent of over 16s\u00a0having now received at least one jab, it's no surprise that vaccinated people are more likely to be represented in hospital data, a point Fact Check has\u00a0previously explained.", "And with just\u00a0one active case\u00a0of COVID-19 in the whole of South Australia, the state's hospital system would, of course, not be brimming with infected patients.", "The protester also falsely claimed that vaccines had led to a surge in fatalities from myocarditis, a rare side-effect from mRNA vaccines that causes\u00a0inflammation of the heart muscle.", "\"We are talking 20-year-olds who have dropped dead,\" she said.", "\"All of a sudden, every third 20-year-old's got myocarditis. You know what that leads to? Cardiac transplant.\"", "But this is not the reality, with the latest Therapeutic Goods Administration\u00a0weekly report on vaccine safety\u00a0showing there have been just two cases of myocarditis per 100,000 doses administered.", "Rates were highest among 18-29 year old males, but still fewer than four cases per 100,000 doses \u2014 a rate that \"includes cases of myocarditis that occurred after vaccination but may not be vaccine related\".", "The Australian Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation (ATAGI)\u00a0has explained\u00a0that \"[m]ost reported cases [of myocarditis] have been mild, self-limiting and have recovered quickly,\" with only a small number of more severe cases requiring hospitalisation.", "There have been no deaths in Australia linked to myocarditis from a COVID-19 jab.", "David Hare, the director of research at Austin Health's Department of Cardiology in Melbourne, told Fact Check that there had been \"no published cases of any [person] needing heart transplantation\" due to a COVID-19 vaccine.", "In any event, he said, patients with myocarditis \"very rarely\" end up in this situation.", "Moreover, SA Health explained, myocarditis is both more common and more severe in people who are infected by COVID-19 than in those who have been vaccinated against it.", "
No, NSW businesses are not liable for vaccine adverse effects
", "Claims that NSW has passed a law holding businesses accountable for vaccine side-effects should a mandate be imposed are incorrect, Fact Check has found.", "\"NSW Govt just brought in a law that employers mandating the jab are now accountable for any adverse reactions suffered,\" allege dozens of posts across Facebook.", "\"They have to pay compensation to that person for the rest of their lives even if they are not working for them anymore.\"", "Many of the posts include links to the\u00a0Public Health Amendment (Vaccination Compensation) Bill 2021, details of which are available on the Parliament of NSW\u00a0website.", "But while the bill indeed seeks to make businesses liable for any adverse effects in some cases, it has not been passed by the parliament and is not law.", "Introduced by the Christian Democratic Party's Fred Nile, the bill proposes that should a \"relevant body\" require a worker to be vaccinated against a disease (not just COVID-19), it would then be \"liable to pay compensation to the worker for any injury, loss or damage suffered by the worker as a result of the vaccine\".", "", "
The NSW government has shown little appetite for passing Christian Democratic MP Fred Nile's bill.(AAP : Joel Carrett)
", "\"The relevant body continues to be liable to pay compensation to the worker until the worker's death, even if the worker ceases to be employed or otherwise engaged by the relevant body,\" the proposal reads.", "Although the bill was introduced to the parliament in February 2021, debate was adjourned and a vote has yet to materialise, with the government showing no interest in passing it.", "
Italy's COVID-19 death toll not amended; more than 130,000 have died
", "A claim that the official COVID-19 death toll in Italy was revised down by \"more than 97 per cent\" has been shared by a popular Australian COVID-19 conspiracy group, despite being debunked by a number of fact checkers.", "According to Facebook posts from Reignite Democracy Australia, the Italian National Institute of Health had \"drastically\" downgraded its official COVID-19 death toll from 130,468 to 3,783.", "The group also republished an article written by\u00a0British conspiracy theorist Paul Joseph Watson\u00a0alleging that the revision came after Italy changed its definition of a COVID-19 fatality \"to someone who died from COVID rather than with COVID\".", "That article drew on a blog post by Toby Young, a well-known conservative writer and journalist in the UK.", "However, while Young has since\u00a0updated\u00a0his post to concede that the claim appeared to be based on an opinion piece that \"severely misrepresents\" the position of the institute, Reignite Democracy Australia has yet to correct the record.", "Fact checkers at AFP\u00a0recently explained\u00a0the origins of the incorrect claim, naming an October 21 article in the Italian newspaper Il Tempo as the most likely culprit.", "According to that article, a report by the Italian institute had apparently found that only 2.9 per cent of COVID-19 deaths could be counted \u2014 those being deaths where no comorbidities (simultaneous health conditions) were recorded.", "But as experts\u00a0have explained, comorbidities increase the risk of severe illness and death in people with COVID-19. Additionally, comorbidities are often caused by COVID-19 itself, with the disease being the underlying cause of death.", "Fact checkers at USA Today\u00a0added\u00a0that Italy's COVID-19 death toll remained close to 130,000 in October, and there was no evidence it was ever officially amended.", "
In other news: PM rewrites Labor's electric vehicle policy
", "Prime Minister Scott Morrison has been caught trying to rewrite history, as he sought to justify his party's newfound support for electric vehicles.", "During a\u00a0news conference\u00a0on November 9, Mr Morrison offered an explanation as to why he opposed Labor's electric vehicles policy during the 2019 federal election, telling reporters:", "", "
'I was against Bill Shorten's policy': PM defends Coalition pivot on electric vehicles
", "However, policy documents\u00a0from the time tell a different story.", "Under Labor, the public service would have been forced to buy more electric cars, but the party's\u00a0Climate Change Action Plan\u00a0made no mention of reducing choices for consumers.", "In fact, as then Labor leader Bill Shorten\u00a0told journalists: \"On electric vehicles, we are not mandating. If you don't want to buy an electric vehicle in 2030, don't.\"", "The party's plan was to set a \"target\" to increase the number of new electric vehicles being sold by 2030, which would \"send a strong signal to car makers to ship a greater range of more affordable EVs\" to Australia.", "Labor's policy also planned to encourage the uptake of electric vehicles by offering tax deductions to businesses and introducing vehicle emissions standards, which some analysts suggested\u00a0would have cut costs for drivers of petrol cars.", "And what about telling people where to drive?", "Labor's policy sought to expand the range of options available to drivers, for example, by requiring that any federally funded road upgrades incorporate electric vehicle charging infrastructure.", "It also planned to create a $200 million fund \"to roll out charging infrastructure across the country\", delivering fast-charging stations to \"rural and regional Australia and Australia's most critical road corridors\".", "Edited by David Campbell, with thanks to Matt Harvey and Olivia Thomson", "Got a fact that needs checking? Tweet us\u00a0@ABCFactCheck\u00a0or send us an email at\u00a0factcheck@rmit.edu.au", "", "
This newsletter is supported by funding from the Judith Nielson Institute for Journalism and Ideas(Judith Nielson Institute)
"]
